natural problem: Alan saved 500 dollars in a bank account that compounds 3 percent annually.  Assuming there are no other transactions, after 10 years, how much is in Alan's bank account?  (Give your answer to the nearest dollar.)
natural solution: After ten years, at a three percent annual interest rate, the bank account will have grown to $500 \cdot 1.03^{10} = \boxed{672}$, to the nearest dollar.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes principal rate years :: real
assumes h0 : "principal = 500"
and h1 : "rate = 0.03"
and h2 : "years = 10"
shows  "round (principal * (1 + rate) powr years) = 672"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Alan saved 500 dollars in a bank account that compounds 3 percent annually.  Assuming there are no other transactions, after 10 years, how much is in Alan's bank account?  (Give your answer to the nearest dollar.) The final Answer is 672
 ### Proof
 After ten years, at a three percent annual interest rate, the bank account will have grown to $500 \cdot 1.03^{10} = \boxed{672}$, to the nearest dollar.
 *)

theorem
fixes principal rate years :: real
assumes h0 : "principal = 500"
and h1 : "rate = 0.03"
and h2 : "years = 10"
shows  "round (principal * (1 + rate) powr years) = 672"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: If you invest $500 at an annual interest rate of 3% for 10 years, how much money will you have at the end of the investment period? Round your answer to the nearest whole number. The final answer is $672.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes P r t :: real
assumes h0 : "P = 500"
and h1 : "r = 0.03"
and h2 : "t = 10"
shows  "round (P * (1 + r) powr t) = 672"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Alan saved 500 dollars in a bank account that compounds 3 percent annually.  Assuming there are no other transactions, after 10 years, how much is in Alan's bank account?  (Give your answer to the nearest dollar.) The final Answer is 672
 ### Proof
 After ten years, at a three percent annual interest rate, the bank account will have grown to $500 \cdot 1.03^{10} = \boxed{672}$, to the nearest dollar.
 *)

theorem
fixes P r t :: real
assumes h0 : "P = 500"
and h1 : "r = 0.03"
and h2 : "t = 10"
shows  "round (P * (1 + r) powr t) = 672"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: What is the rounded final amount after 10 years if an initial principal of 500 dollars is invested with an annual interest rate of 3% compounded continuously? The final answer is 672 dollars.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes P A r n t :: real
assumes h0 : "P = 500"
and h1 : "r = 0.03"
and h2 : "t = 10"
and h3 : "A = P * (1 + r) powr t"
shows  "\<lceil>A\<rceil> = 672"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Alan saved 500 dollars in a bank account that compounds 3 percent annually.  Assuming there are no other transactions, after 10 years, how much is in Alan's bank account?  (Give your answer to the nearest dollar.) The final Answer is 672
 ### Proof
 After ten years, at a three percent annual interest rate, the bank account will have grown to $500 \cdot 1.03^{10} = \boxed{672}$, to the nearest dollar.
 *)

theorem
fixes P A r n t :: real
assumes h0 : "P = 500"
and h1 : "r = 0.03"
and h2 : "t = 10"
and h3 : "A = P * (1 + r) powr t"
shows  "\<lceil>A\<rceil> = 672"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: If you invest $500 at an annual interest rate of 3% compounded continuously for 10 years, what is the least whole dollar amount that the investment will be worth? The final answer is $672.

a_3.formal problem:

fixes initial_savings interest_rate years :: real
assumes h0 : "initial_savings = 500"
and h1 : "interest_rate = 0.03"
and h2 : "years = 10"
shows  "round (initial_savings * (1 + interest_rate) powr years) = 672"
a_3.formal solution:

 ### Proof
 After ten years, at a three percent annual interest rate, the bank account will have grown to $500 \cdot 1.03^{10} = \boxed{672}$, to the nearest dollar.
 *)

fixes initial_savings interest_rate years :: real

and h1 : "interest_rate = 0.03"
and h2 : "years = 10"
shows  "round (initial_savings * (1 + interest_rate) powr years) = 672"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: If you start with an initial savings of $500 and earn an interest rate of 3% per year, how much money will you have after 10 years, rounded to the nearest dollar? The final answer is $672.

a_6.formal problem:

assumes h0 : "p = 500"
and h1 : "r = 0.03"
and h2 : "t = 10"
and h3 : "A = p * (1 + r) powr t"
shows  "round A = 672"
a_6.formal solution:

 Alan saved 500 dollars in a bank account that compounds 3 percent annually.  Assuming there are no other transactions, after 10 years, how much is in Alan's bank account?  (Give your answer to the nearest dollar.) The final Answer is 672
 ### Proof
 After ten years, at a three percent annual interest rate, the bank account will have grown to $500 \cdot 1.03^{10} = \boxed{672}$, to the nearest dollar.
 *)

fixes p :: real and r :: real and t :: real and A :: real
assumes h0 : "p = 500"
and h1 : "r = 0.03"
and h2 : "t = 10"
and h3 : "A = p * (1 + r) powr t"
shows  "round A = 672"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer

a_8.formal problem:
theorem
fixes P r t :: real
assumes h0 : "P = 500"
and h1 : "r = 3 / 100"
and h2 : "t = 10"
and h3 : "P * (1 + r) powr t = A"
shows  "round A = 672"
a_8.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Alan saved 500 dollars in a bank account that compounds 3 percent annually.  Assuming there are no other transactions, after 10 years, how much is in Alan's bank account?  (Give your answer to the nearest dollar.) The final Answer is 672
 ### Proof
 After ten years, at a three percent annual interest rate, the bank account will have grown to $500 \cdot 1.03^{10} = \boxed{672}$, to the nearest dollar.
 *)

theorem
fixes P r t :: real
assumes h0 : "P = 500"
and h1 : "r = 3 / 100"
and h2 : "t = 10"
and h3 : "P * (1 + r) powr t = A"
shows  "round A = 672"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_8.informal problem: Suppose you invest $500 at an annual interest rate of 3%. After 10 years, how much money will you have in the account, rounded to the nearest dollar? The final answer is $672.

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes P :: real and r :: real and t :: nat
assumes h0 : "P = 500"
and h1 : "r = 0.03"
and h2 : "t = 10"
shows  "\<exists> A. A = round (P * (1 + r) powr t) \<and> A = 672"
a_9.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Alan saved 500 dollars in a bank account that compounds 3 percent annually.  Assuming there are no other transactions, after 10 years, how much is in Alan's bank account?  (Give your answer to the nearest dollar.) The final Answer is 672
 ### Proof
 After ten years, at a three percent annual interest rate, the bank account will have grown to $500 \cdot 1.03^{10} = \boxed{672}$, to the nearest dollar.
 *)

theorem
fixes P :: real and r :: real and t :: nat
assumes h0 : "P = 500"
and h1 : "r = 0.03"
and h2 : "t = 10"
shows  "\<exists> A. A = round (P * (1 + r) powr t) \<and> A = 672"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_9.informal problem: An initial principal of $500 is invested at an annual interest rate of 3% compounded continuously. What will be the balance after 10 years, rounded to the nearest dollar? The final answer is $672.
